questions.q: What does the 'Cascading' in Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) refer to?
options: The way images flow around text
The process of combining multiple style sheets and resolving conflicts between them
The method of downloading files from a server
A specific type of font animation
questions.explanation: Cascading means style information is passed down from higher-level sheets until overridden by a command with more weight, resolving conflicts during the process [1].

questions.q: Which organization created CSS to solve formatting problems in HTML?
questions.explanation: To solve the nightmare of manual formatting in early HTML versions, the W3C created CSS [2].

questions.q: What are the three ways to insert a style sheet into an HTML document?
questions.explanation: Styles can be inserted via an external style sheet, an internal style sheet, or inline styles [3].

questions.q: Which HTML tag is used to link an external CSS file to an HTML page?
questions.explanation: The <link> tag is used in the head section to define an external style sheet [4-6].

questions.q: In CSS syntax, what does the 'declaration block' contain?
options: One or more declarations separated by semicolons, each with a property and a value
The file path to the image
A list of all linked JavaScript files
questions.explanation: A declaration block contains one or more declarations (e.g., color: red;) separated by semicolons [7].

questions.q: What is the correct way to write a comment in CSS?
questions.explanation: A CSS comment starts with /* and ends with */ [8].

questions.q: If a font name consists of more than one word, how should it be written in the font-family property?
questions.explanation: If the name of a font family is more than one word, it must be in quotation marks, such as 'Times New Roman' [9, 10].

questions.q: How many pixels (px) are typically equal to 1 em in the default browser setting?
What are the four components of the CSS Box Model, starting from the innermost layer?
questions.explanation: The box model consists of content, padding, border, and margin [12, 13].

questions.q: Which CSS property is used to create space around elements, inside any defined borders?
questions.explanation: Padding clears an area around the content inside the border, while margin clears space outside the border [5, 6, 13, 14].

questions.q: When using the shorthand padding property 'padding: 25px 50px 75px 100px;', what is the correct order of the sides?
questions.explanation: The shorthand order for four values is Top, Right, Bottom, and then Left [15].

questions.q: Which style insertion method has the highest priority (is the most powerful) in the cascading order?
questions.explanation: Inline styles (inside an HTML element) have the highest priority, followed by internal, then external, and finally browser defaults [16].

questions.q: Which of the following properties is NOT typically inherited by child elements from their parents?
questions.explanation: While properties like color and font-family are inherited, layout properties like margin, padding, border, and background-color are not [17].

questions.q: In CSS, how do you select elements with the class name 'menu'?
questions.explanation: Classes are defined and selected using a period (.) followed by the class name [18-20].

questions.q: Which symbol is used for the universal selector, which affects all elements on a page?
questions.explanation: The universal selector is represented by the asterisk (*) symbol [18].
